lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Hello, everyone and welcome to ta-te-ple-plah. It's already off to a good start, huh?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: (laughs) Yes.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Beautiful.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Live streaming.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Welcome to this evening's episode of Critical Role, where a bunch of us nerdy-ass voice actors sit around and play Dungeons & Dragons.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: And make fun of our DM.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So tomorrow I guess is the next one. I'm not quite sure what topic it's on, but it should be fun. So check that out. As a reminder, most of us are going to be present at Wizard World Portland next month. We'll be there Saturday and Sunday for the con, and we'll have a panel both days. I think Saturday is the Critical Role panel, and Sunday is going to be more of a voiceover-related one, so hope to see you guys there. Bring your stuff if you want to have it signed and come get ready to ask questions and hang out, basically.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: And par-ty!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: And also find us during the days in the general hall area, we'll be around quite a bit.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, we'll be around. So, if you would like to see us possibly come to a Wizard World near you in the future, go ahead and send a tweet to Wizard World's Twitter, and let them know how excited you'd be to see us at more events in the future, because that would make them more inclined to want to bring us to more events! Let's see-- Also as a reminder, me and Marisha will be at Colorado Anime Fest, February 12th through the 14th in Denver, Colorado.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Valentine's Day Weekend.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yep, so we'll be out there, hanging with you folks in Colorado. You should come say hello, we'd love to see you. Also, a reminder, the Dungeon Masters Guild, awesome new opportunity for content creators for Dungeons and Dragons. You know, create your own classes, your own rules, your own feats, your own stuff. There's a great place to put it up there, and you can set your price for it. You can check out my most updated version of the Blood Hunter and recently updated Gunslinger, which is now version 1.1, just went up yesterday, so if you have one of those you can update that and get the newest set. A couple minor changes and tweaks.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: And it's super cool.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Anything I need to know about?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Nothing you have to worry about yet. It was mainly the level 15 ability piercing shot and a couple of clarifications that I know. You'll be fine.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It's for you to find out, all right.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That's his subtle way of saying I'm not going to make level 15.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Could be. Ouch. We shall see. All right, Wyrmwood Gaming, awesome friend of the show. They still have their 'critrole' discount code, you get free shipping if you go ahead and order something from their site, really awesome-

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: 'critrole'. The code is 'critrole'.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Pretty wood. That's a cool arrangement, I like that.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Thanks. I designed it like this.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: You're so creative.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You know her as Mikandii, is her Twitter. She has a cool little thing for you.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yes I will, I am very excited

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Is it you and Gilmore making out?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Wow!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What is it? What is it?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Wow. Oh, nothing.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Wow! That's amazing!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I haven't seen it yet, so I'm excited.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Wow. It's beautiful. Thank you.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh my god, he looks so dreamy.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So, go to @VoiceofOBrien to see what apparently he is looking at, that I have no idea what it is. Hopefully it's not just a giant dick.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: That's included.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It's subversive. It's what you see in the art.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Now I'm excited for that.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I voice a character named Simmons in there. It's fun. Go check it out.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: That's a good pitch.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Did you have something you wanted to announce?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Home Entertainment's Batman: Bad Blood! Which is out right now on Digital Download on iTunes. It's solid rock. Can't move.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Solid rock.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah. I play the Heretic. Matt plays a million other people. It's really cool, check it out. We fight Batman.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah! I get electrocuted.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I sing Taylor Swift songs and all that.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Oh, and last but not least announcement, next Monday on Ivan's wonderful RPG show No Survivors, me, Laura, Felicia, Wil, a bunch of people, I haven't looked at the full list yet, are all going to be guesting on that as players for a round of one of my favorite RPGs, Paranoia.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Which I haven't ever played. But Ivan was telling me about it and it sounds like so much fun.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, it's one of my favorite RPG systems ever. So next Monday, go check out No Survivors. We're all going to be playing Paranoia and making ridiculous choices and probably dying in horrible, wonderful ways, so, we'll be there for that. Hi, Sam. Glad you could join us, buddy.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (whispering) Thanks.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Sam Riegel, ladies and gentlemen.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Hi, Sam.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I like this sweater, is this new?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Thanks. Yeah.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It's so hot in here, though.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh no, I'll take it off.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh god!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Where's Scanlan on the map?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He's right over here. You can work towards over there shortly.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: All this time you've been trying to kick my teeth in and your real enemy is right over here.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: True colors, (singing) shining through! (laughter)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right! Good, it's getting you in character, perfect. So now we've finished all the announcements I believe, if anyone has anything else we're going to go ahead and get into tonight's episode of Critical Role. So, where we left off, our intrepid adventurers, Vox Machina, having returned the traitor Riskel Daxio to Sovereign Uriel in the center of the town of Emon, Grog beheading him as part of his punishment for being such a traitorous worshiper of the evil entity known as Vecna. Upon going out for a pub crawl, came across Gilmore in a secret speakeasy, managed to enjoy a Heroes' Feast at his expense, whereas Vex and Vax both, all of you, got pretty-- Keyleth got very-- drunk.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I didn't get drunk at all.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That's right, you didn't drink.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I got pretty wasted.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Gilmore had a very intense conversation with Vax over there to ensure where they stood, and Keyleth vomited multiple times. But after which the party found their way back to the Keep, where Dr. Dranzel and his Spectacular Traveling Troupe were drinking and expecting you to be there, in which they could converse and try and convince you of a little caper they've been trying to get their head around for a while, and you seem to have the entry to this possible windfall of money. Scanlan, after courting this young, pixie-haired gnome--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Was instead confronted in his bedroom by Kaylie, who revealed herself to be Scanlan's long-unknown daughter from many years ago, who had trained very hard as a bard at the College of the White Duke, in Westruun, and honed her skills with a blade with the intent of finding you one day and disgracing you. Thanks to Scanlan's sudden realization, change of heart, and attempt to connect with his lost blood, broke a bit of that cold honed exterior, and managed to prevent a very dangerous and possibly deadly encounter. She left frustrated and confused, and hasn't been seen since. The rest of you, gathering the next morning, discussed this endeavor with Dr. Dranzel and how they had found a home that had been long abandoned after being purchased by a collector. A home that you guys had ransacked a little over a year before after finding a portal within that led to a dragon's hoard, as the previous person who lived there, General Krieg, was actually a dragon who had infiltrated the Council.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I was really sad when it turned out he was--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Upon you, Scanlan, and Trinket inquiring there, the rest of the party scattered. Pike and Keyleth went to find what seemed to be the owner of the house, now frozen in fright in a far alcove. And the three, the rest of your group, traveling towards the mouth of the cavern itself, before the ground begins to rumble. Suddenly, exploding from the rock and shale of the bottom of the cavern floor, you guys managed to see before you, piercing forth from the ground itself, a very, very large, segmented, armored, worm-like entity.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Armored?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The actual hide itself is like very, very thick.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Super thick? Ugh!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Like with armor?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Not with armor, just this natural sense.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: When we kill it, we can make armor out of him.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: And it was pale and icy, too, I think you were describing?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It was darkish purple in its color and tint, like dark blacks, purple, with rows and rows of teeth coming out of its eyeless face. As it bursts out of the surface, I need you all to roll initiative.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh my god, right away, right away. We're just in it. Just like that.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Fuck yeah!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, so. 25 to 20?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: That's it?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 15 to ten?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Ten.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, then comes ten to five?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Nine.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: And Pike, while, as she's not here, rolled the lowest. Ashley, unfortunately, due to scheduling, could not be here this evening. So far, we're hoping she might show up at some point tonight, we'll find out. But, in the meantime, I'm going to be running Pike on my end. So, starting the encounter, as you see this giant worm creature through the tunnel, the three of you now walking the other direction, you, feeling the rumble, turn around, holding forth your greatsword unsheathed, you can feel the power pulsing with each beat of your blood through your body, as a little voice in the back of your head, stemming from your weapon, goes, "Kill." You're up, Grog.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Well, I hope you're hungry. But you have to wait one second, we're a bit far away. Can I travel as far as I can towards?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Speed of 50, I believe?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I said I hid.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Right, roll stealth.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Do I have a line of sight with him, or is the edge of that outcropping blocking it?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He would have half cover if you were to try and like, throw your weapon at him. It'd be a plus five to his armor class.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Pike and I are hiding, too.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, stealth check for both of you.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Could I back up three squares, so that I could move to my left so I could get a straight look at him?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There, you mean?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Can I go one more?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That's the extent of your movement right there, unfortunately. Unless you want to go at this angle, there. There you go.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Can I use the Javelin of Lightning?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: What the fuck is that? That's a thing you made up.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh, yeah, I've got it. I utter the magic word "Penelope" and I throw it and each creature in the line, excluding me and the target, must make a DC 13 dexterity saving throw.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, there are no creatures in the line, just the target.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Just the target then.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Did you get that in Yug'Voril?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Huh?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yug'Voril. Is it from Yug'Voril?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I don't remember, it's just in the bag.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: In Yug'Voril, at the bottom of that pit, when he headbutted the giant.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yup, that was in the rubble.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah! Ding!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Good memory!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Can I try and throw it?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You may, go for it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 18 total? 18 just hits. So, go ahead and roll damage for the javelin. As you rear back, aim it with your eyes, and the frustration is palpable from Craven Edge as you put it aside to throw the javelin instead as it arcs into a bolt of energy that streaks forth, slams into the hide of the giant purple worm. Go ahead and roll damage.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 19. All righty. Great. It rears in place, shakes itself for a second. It has no eyes, so it's not looking in any different direction, it just seems to be flailing in its current location.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Can I go into a rage?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yes you may.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I would like to rage.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. (laughs)

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Are you rolling your special dice?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That ends your turn. Keyleth, you're up.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Can I do, like, a nature check on this thing to see if I can discern any type of information on it?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Sure. Go ahead and make an intelligence check.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Just straight intelligence? That's not good. I think that is a five? Six! Six!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Six. You have no recollection of this type of an entity in your travels. It's definitely not natural, it's not of nature, and you've seen various types of eyeless worm-type creatures, but nowhere near on this scale. So, yeah. You have no idea beyond that.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'm just going to whisper to Pike, and be like: It doesn't have any eyes! I feel like we shouldn't move!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: She goes, "Okay!" And she gets as still as she possibly can. "It's good! Moving's not my forte."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Okay! I, like, hold her shoulder pads so she doesn't clink any.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Okay!"

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Okay! I'm going to stay right here!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. So that ends your turn. Vax, you're up. Unless you want to do something else on your turn, is that it?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'm just, I'm just going to, I don't want to move. I'm just going to wait.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (mocking) I don't want to, I don't want to move!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I don't want to move!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah. I think I can make it there.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. You can get there.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Do I need to roll stealth?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You can roll stealth, yeah.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I want to throw a dagger at it. Yeah. That is 28.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: And you get the essence as soon as you see the creature, its head follows you across the room, you get the sense immediately that it is not a sight-based creature, it is definitely a movement-based creature, and its head just follows you as you move.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I'll defer, but let me ask, going stealth and rolling a 28 on stealth, the footsteps were still enough to alert it to where I was?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Is it a natural 20?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I didn't attack yet. No, it was a combined 28, just to go stealth.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: A combined 28. Right, even so, not quite light enough. Not with the knowledge that it was an issue with this entity, and due to the proximity of it, and it being a very sensitive creature to the rock's movement, it still picks you up.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: And I should have one attack. I should have an attack, right? Because I did the boots, I ran over here--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yep, so you have an attack.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Two.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Well, two attacks, you have offhand, so yeah.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Two, yeah. Two, because it was double the speed because of the boots. All right. First one is shit. That is 14. And the second one is-- I'm going to do Luck on that. The second one is 20.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The second one hits. The first one unfortunately just bounces off of its hide.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: That's not a lot. But it is seven points of damage.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Seven points of damage, got it.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: First blood. First blood, everyone.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It's looking pretty beat up.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. At this point in time, the dagger embeds itself in. You see the hilt sinks into the hide and then vanishes in a puff of smoke as it returns to your belt, however you can see a little bit of black liquid pouring forth from it, and its head has been trained on you since you moved across the room. The worm now disappears beneath the ground.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Not cool.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: And you feel the ground beneath you begin to shake, as it bursts out of the ground. That's a 20 to hit.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: 20? Can I use Evasion or no?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Huh? What's your AC?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Oh, with the boots on, 18.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It rolled a 20.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah, I know. So tell me what happens.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So, as you look around you all of a sudden the jaws start coming up out of the ground behind you, the teeth biting into your body as you try and wrest yourself away from its grip. You take 20 points of piercing damage.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Oh, well, Uncanny Dodge. Right? Evasion is for spell effects--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Right, Evasion does not help you in this circumstance, Uncanny Dodge allows you to reduce the damage by half. So yes, you can do that. So you take ten damage instead. I need you to make a dexterity saving throw.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: That's okay. All right, so. Okay. Natural 20!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As the jaws attempt to clamp around you, you manage to just pull yourself away, tearing your knees across the teeth, but rolling in the opposite direction, right in the place where you were as it bursts out of the ground just beside you and rights itself around in that direction. As its full body emerges now, you can see its tail flop out of the tunnel it just made with this giant hooked stinger on the end as it whips off in your direction. That is going to be a 15 to hit.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: That'll miss.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That misses you. As the stinger swings towards you, you manage to just duck out of the way, your eyes trained on it in an absolute red fury, and it just whiffs past your face.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Could've been bad, could've been bad.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That ends its turn. Scanlan, you're up.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Who's in front of me?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Right now you're next to Trinket and Vex is behind you.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: (laughing) Don't be a dick!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'm not going to be a dick. I brush past Trinket so I can see the worm.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, about there, you can see it from that perspective.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Scanlan's eyes! All right, so the Eyebite refers to my eyes. He doesn't need eyes. He doesn't need to be able to see me, I have to be able to see him, right? It works. Okay, so I'm going to do Sicken.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So as your spell completes on it, you can see its form contracts for a second and its head hangs a little less strong as it did previously. It almost goes slack for a moment from the impact of the spell affecting its physical form. All right, so it has disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks, for as long as it lasts. All right, so that's your movement, that's your action, any bonus actions?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I will inspire Vex. With a limerick.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I can't wait.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That was wonderful!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: A d10 inspiration die to you, Vex.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yay!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Plus or minus?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (laughs) We'll see.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Am I able to take a bonus action to like shout something out over comms?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I'll allow it, since you held your turn this turn anyways, yeah.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah? Everyone should try and get a little bit so I can see you. And I can make us all fly.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: (shouting) What? You can make us fly?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I learned it today. But you have to be within 30 feet of me.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, really, but I'm so far away from you.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: You know, imagine I said it more succinctly than this.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Percy, you're up.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: All right, I'm going to head in the direction of the message I just received. So I'm going to crawl around the bottom there.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Ugh, I'm not going to be able to get to her.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That's as far as you can get.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yeah, okay. Not too close. That's not bad, 21.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 21 hits.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: 28 points of damage.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Quick reload, going to get one more shot off and I'm going to take this one with the sharpshooter effect just to see how things go.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Sure. The sharpshooter effect, you mean the deadeye?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yep. Yeah, the deadeye. The negative five to hit.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Oh, got you, got you, all right.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 14 does not hit, unfortunately. As you load the second round, you pull Bad News in front of you and you go to fire, the ground actually shakes beneath you. There's a quaking. Not sure if it's from the creature or just the atmosphere around you, but as you do the gun just misfires and, well, it actually doesn't misfire, but it fires off into one of the side elements of the cave and you hear it ricochet off the rock.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That's what I got.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, Vex, you're up.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Okay. Will you be able to move forward?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Okay. I'm going to send Trinket up to that little alcove. Keep running, no, a little further-- a little further.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That's-- what's Trinket's movement? Is it 40? So he can go there.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That's as close as he can get to you.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Six, actually seven, eight. So that'd be the full movement.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Okay. Get him tucked into that little side.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Trinket is now stepping onto a bit of slick of ice and is like (unbalanced bear noises) but seems to be okay at the moment.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Okay. And then I move forward so I can see him. Right there. All right. And I'm going to Hunter's Mark him! And then I'm going to shoot my Longbow of the Sky Sentinel at him. So that, I'm going to shoot an arrow and it divides into three arrows and they all turn into storm arrows. So I roll an attack for each one of those for my first attack.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Correct. Yep. Yep. As you release the arrow from the actual tension of the bow, as soon as it leaves your fingers it almost burns the tips as it races into this arrow of pure energy. As it divides in the middle of the air, you can see each arrow sparking off bits of electrical power on its--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Okay, so the first one is a 26.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Hits.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Should I roll damage for that one?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Roll to see how many hit.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: The second one is a 29.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Hits.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: The third one is a 20.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 20 hits. Yeah, all three hit.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: This is all happening in less than six seconds.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: 17-- 20. 23 for the first arrow.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All righty.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I feel bad for this thing.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: 22. 20, what is that? 27 for the third.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Oof, all right. As each arrow slams into its side, you can see portions of its large chitinous, almost like armored shell crack and break open. And you can see now these streams of black worm blood are spilling down its side. And it starts shaking in place now in pain.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Okay. I'm going to shoot through my Blazing Bowstring for my second attack.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Second attack?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah, that was just one.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, she gets that once a day.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 25 hits.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: You have more dice than that dice store.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I know, it's ridiculous. 16-- 16-- 19, and then an additional d10. So 19 of fire damage. So 25 for the third.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 25. Oof. That is a nasty round. Well done.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: For the fourth arrow.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As this fourth arrow slams into its side there's a burst of fire from the impact and you can see it now. It's starting to shriek this horrible high-pitched multi-toned scream. All right, that ends your turn.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: And I rolled a 15 for stealth, not that it probably matters anymore.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Nah, no, it doesn't really. All right.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: And then I stay very, very still.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Cool, so does Pike. Pike's going to follow in Keyleth's order and spend the round just keeping in place, very quietly. All right, top of the round again. Grog, you're up.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh, are we flying?

lines.name: ALL
lines.text: No.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Fuck it! I take Craven Edge out. I hope you're hungry. And I would like to go into a frenzied rage.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: And I would like to attack, the first two times, at the big purple dick that just came out of the ground.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Hey, move down a bit so you're not in my way.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Which way?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Grog's just charging in.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: That's a 23?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 23 hits.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 20 hits.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Wow. 26?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All three hit. These are non-Great Weapon Master, right?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: The third one I wanted it to be, should I reroll since I didn't specify?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Reroll because you didn't say it, yeah.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That misses, unfortunately. But the first two do hit. Yeah, you got to mention that before you make the attack.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I do, I do. You're right. 2d6. What do sixes look like? They're squares.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Cubes, really.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Jeez, three, eight, 16 for the first one.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All righty.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: And 16 for the second one.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All righty. What's the DC on the sword effect, again? Is it 12?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh! Yep.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. So it succeeds its first saving throw and it succeeds its second saving throw. But you do see with each strike the intent of the sword to draw some of the strength and life force from the target. Not really making any effect, unfortunately. All right! Ending your turn, Grog, that vibration you feel in the ground, now? It's curious, because the worm itself is out of the ground, now. What caused you to lose your shot? You feel it grow stronger and stronger, before suddenly, nearby, a secondary, different-looking, but similar in size, worm comes bursting out of the base of the cavern.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Matthew Mercer! You're trying to kill us.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You can see now, as this bursts out, it's similar in size, but different. This one has a thicker body, it's a purple and white type exterior, and you can see frozen mist is just emanating from the outside of its open jaw.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No, this is the one that pukes ice.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: (laughs) Pukes ice?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: This is what made the dude frozen!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As this one rears back, opens its jaw, and a burst of cold air and ice shards comes spraying out of its mouth--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Look at this cone you have.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Heading towards these-- actually, it would get the other worm too.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yes! Yes! Freeze the other worm!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I need a constitution saving throw from Grog and Vax.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I want to do an Evasion, that's an area effect!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make your constitution saving throw.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: All right. (laughs) Do I do the dex save first, or--?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's not a dex save. Constitution save.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Whatever you say. Natural 20.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 21. All right. Good.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Saving throw, right? Constitution?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Constitution saving throw. So, read your ability real fast, does it affect only dex saves?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Evasion on dex save-- I've written an abbreviated version of this. It's area of effect, if it's like Fireball or anything that's in an area.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Right, but I think it may specify whether or not--

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Oh, but you're god, what do you want me to do?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I'm just looking it up right now, give me a second.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Ooh! I have Danger Sense. I have advantage on dexterity saving throws.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: This is not dexterity. This is constitution.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh, but you know what? I have really good dexterity.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yep, dexterity saving throw. So this does not affect this attack. Sorry. All right, so you both take half damage, as does the creature.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That's a lot of rolling.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: He's only rolling a d2. He's rolling a d2.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right! That's 40 points of damage, halved, that's 20 points of cold damage to each of you, and the purple worm.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Wait, 40 or 20?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Holy shit.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It does 40 points?!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Can I do Uncanny-- this is a new round, can I do Uncanny or not, yet?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It has not gotten back to your turn, so no.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We're going to die!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: No, we're good! Shut up! We're fine!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. Now! It's Keyleth's turn.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Here's what I want to try and do. I want to try and hope to god I can get everyone in here.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Shake that hangover off, Kiki.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I wanted to-- oh wait, I'm trying to point the fucking-- point the laser at the screen.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, don't point at the screen. Point it at the actual map. That's okay.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I want to try and go-- five, ten, 15-- can I go through Grog? Through there?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You can try to, yeah.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You're going to go past the worm, though!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Can I go there? Wait, wait, back closer to the-- I want to be able to try and-- can I see Scanlan and stuff, over there?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You can see Scanlan, you can see pretty much everybody but Trinket from this perspective, and you can't see Pike.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Shit.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: All right.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Thought I was helping.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Everyone, I guess, who's within 30 range of me, I'm going to do a wind blast, and we all turn into poofy cloud versions of ourselves.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Which one is this?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Wind Walk. Poofy Cloud. So as I run past Grog, I brush his shoulder, and he turns into a mist form, and I turn into a mist form, and then I blast it out, and everyone's mist form!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, cool. So while in mist form, you guys have a flying speed of 300 feet, you have resistance to non-magical weapons, you can only dash.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh, you can't attack?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No. You've got to read your spell. You can take a minute to revert your form, but as of right now, all of you guys currently, everyone within 30 feet.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'm not within 30 feet.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Doesn't affect you guys. Scanlan is just out of range. So Vex and Scanlan, you're unaffected. You watch half of the party turn into these gaseous forms.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh my god, the worms have turned us all into clouds!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You've left us stranded. We're going to die.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: No, we're still there.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It takes a minute to revert to your actual form to be able to do any sort of attack.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Man, that was going to be way cooler if we could still...

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm going to do something insane. I've got some plans.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It was a 6th-level spell.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I know.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It was so good.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Thanks, guys. I feel so validated.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: She just learned it yesterday!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I did just learn it yesterday.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Vax, it's your turn.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: And I'm made of wind?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You're made of wind. You can move. You can dash, or you can begin to revert, if you'd like.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I can begin to revert? So it's a minute-long process that I have to consciously decide, and I know this?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You get the feeling that if you want to return, it will take you a while because you don't really know what to do with your form.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: We could try and get the fuck out of here.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I'm going to use disengage and I'm going to fart over towards my sister and Pike.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You cannot disengage. You can only dash in this form.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Oh, then I'm going to dash towards my sister and Pike.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Pike is on the other side. Me and Scanlan.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Oh. Scanlan and Vex, sorry.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So you move over.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Not all short people look alike.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You dash over here. That guy's going to take an attack of opportunity on you. He's going to have disadvantage, technically, because you all of a sudden stopped moving and it just hears the sound. It rolled a three. No. It whips past you with its mouth biting at nothing.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I want to land and then start thinking, god, I wish I was not made of farts, and start trying to undo whatever this is.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. Ten rounds later, you will be a physical entity.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Ten rounds?!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: A minute.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Dispel Magic, little man!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Okay, can I see him? Can I shoot through him?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You can shoot through him. He'll take half damage.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I'm crouching!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: We could use this to our advantage and get the fuck away, so I don't feel like I just wasted a 6th-level spell. Just want to say.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Fog of war, man.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Do you have Dispel Magic, Scanlan?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Sorry.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I technically do, but fuck that.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You can float up to the ceiling and then attack from high.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I did learn Dispel Magic, but--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Well, dispel your own shit.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: No! Figure it out! Make it work for yourselves, assholes. That was a 6th-level spell, god damn it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Did you make yourself mist, as well?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah! It's ten people!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You can't cast a spell in mist form, either.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: We're all shit out of luck! How does that feel?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So who's left, currently? That finishes Vax's turn.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Everyone who's a cloud, we're floating back to Emon. Let's go.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: (singing) I can show you the world.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I thought we could still attack, which would be way dope.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That would be dope, but that would be way too powerful a spell for sixth level. This is more of a means of travel spell, or a means of escape spell.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Let's solve the problem

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: But half of the party is still not able to escape.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: If you don't move, they'll go away.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (impact noise) It bursts out of the ground right in front of you. It brings its jaw down over the top, with disadvantage. That's a natural 20, so thank god it has disadvantage. 19.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'm going to use Cutting Words to try and not have it hit me.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'll sing, (singing) do you really want to hurt me? Do you really want to bite my body? Okay, that taunts him.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, go ahead and roll a d10 to reduce that from the attack.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: A d10. this one? Wait, that's yours; why am I doing yours?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That's a 19 plus nine. This is 28 is what it rolled total.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: 28 is what it rolled total?!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It rolled a 19 on the dice.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh fuck, even if I rolled a ten, I couldn't do anything. I rolled a three.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, so as you're singing this, its jaw comes down on you (slamming sound), bites down painfully onto Scanlan for-- that's the wrong dice--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: This could go worse.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Shut up, Taliesin.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 19 points of piercing damage. And I need you to go ahead and make a dexterity saving throw.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yeah, yeah, yeah, sure, sure, that's a five.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Those of you who are watching, you see as the mouth (impact sound) chomps down on Scanlan and as it pulls away, Scanlan is nowhere in sight, having been swallowed by the purple worm.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Oh, shit!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You just see darkness and you feel the muscles constricting as you're forced down its throat. As your feet splash into what seems to be some sort of highly acidic liquid that resides in the inside of its body.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: When he grabbed me was the cone still close to my mouth?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Sure, we'll say that. However, I do need you to make a concentration check because of the damage you sustained on this.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Okay. Concentration check. Concentration? I've never rolled for concentration. Oh wait!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I know, I'm trying to keep up on that more now.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I have advantage on spell concentration.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Because of your feat that you took.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Well, that wasn't good either. So one was a five and one was a ten. Do I add anything to that?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right so, it's a constitution saving throw and half the damage you took. So you're trying to beat a nine.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Constitution. So 12.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So 12. So yes, you succeed. So you currently, even though you're constrained, you're still maintaining your Eyebite spell against the purple worm.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Scanlan, it is now your turn.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Great. I don't want be in here anymore.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Correct.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Seems nicer than outside right now, actually. I dip my finger in the acid. Ooo!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (sizzling sound) Not fun, not fun.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It's not good. So I'm going to make him barf me up.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh that's right, it was sick, right?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, Thunderwave. So at fifth level, that would be an additional 4d8. That is 6d8 thunder damage.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Holy shit.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Where's the d8s?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It makes a constitution saving throw.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: He's inside. Come on, Armageddon this motherfucker.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That is a 16 on the saving throw.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: 19 is my save.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So, 6d8.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: What's that? I've already lost count. 15 plus seven. Whatever that is.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 22 points of--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Wait 6d8, yeah okay.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. It (impact sound) booms from the inside and you can see a central part of the worm (muffled boom) billow out like a cartoon as this bit of smoke emanates from its mouth. Just the sheer force of it forces you a little ways up its throat, but not enough to jettison yourself out of its body. Its muscles are too strong and you feel like you need to do a little more damage to it from the inside to be able to escape.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Okay. But it did hurt it, yes?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It hurt it, yeah. It took some damage. And at this point as well, you (grunt) feel your body being pulled inward and crushed by the muscles. Percy. You're up, Mr. Mistform.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Okay. These creatures have no eyes.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Correct.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm made of smoke.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (affirmative sound)

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: (sighs) Okay.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yes. Well established.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: As long as we're all clear here what's going on, that's fine. And I can just dash?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That's all you can do. Or begin to try and revert, which will take ten rounds.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Well, and can I still move around and do things while I'm trying to revert or is it-- Reverting. Am I just stuck reverting?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You know, that's a good question.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Can I just make the decision?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I think you can still move around, you just think you have to have concentration towards it, I'll have to--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm going to have my concentration on reverting. But in the meantime, I'm going to--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You can use your action to begin to revert your form, yeah.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I have to use my action?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: However, nope! Reverting takes a minute, during which time a creature is incapacitated and can't move.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: (sputtering)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So yeah. So currently--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah he's really married to this one.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It took me ten seconds to read it!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: So to get out of this form, we have to stop and like meditate in one position for a full minute. What does it dissipate without doing that? How long does it take?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Eight hours.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Eight hours, good.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Wait, what? No, no, no! One-- Oh no, yeah, you're right.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Can't you just kill it? Wait a second, hold on a second.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, can I not kill it at all? I can't kill it?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Not if you're in wind form, no.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Question. Can I switch to an animal form?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You cannot take any other action aside from dash or reverting when in this form.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Can I dash into one of the creatures?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Why would you do that?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I mean, you could try to. You would surround it with smoke.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You're made of wind!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It wouldn't know that I was there? It wouldn't--

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: You could either dispel it or you could flee.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Okay, well I had the thought of maybe I could attempt to get them to attack each other.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: What are you trying to do?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm attempting to tap them to get them to think that there's something happening where the worms are to get them to attack.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Like a Three Stooges thing.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, so you swirl this way as a dash and attempt to make an impact. I'll say go ahead and make a strength check.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Really?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yes. With disadvantage and a serious penalty.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Natural 20, Motherfucker!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, roll again, because it's with disadvantage.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: (screams) (laughter)

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Here comes the one.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Which brings me to four.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. As the coldish mist of Percy batters itself helplessly and ineffective against the body of the giant frost worm creature, seeming to no effect as it's now keeping itself attentive on what is nearby and within its range of motion.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I will use an action surge and start turning back into a normal human then.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Well, you can continue to use your movement; you only moved a short bit.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That way. No, I mean far away from it. And then I'm going to use an action surge and start meditating on it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, it does attempt to take an attack of opportunity as it just feels you rush by. Nah, it misses. Rolled a two.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That's what it feels like, motherfucker.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. So, that end your turn?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yeah that ended it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, Vex, you're up.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Cool.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Vex, you and me babe, all we got to do is last ten rounds. Of course, all you hear is (muffled cries).

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I know, I've got to save you!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Trinket's there too.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I know.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Oh, I get to make the save to see if the Eyebite maintains itself. That would be a-- no, it rolled a ten and it's minus two on its wisdom save. So it still has disadvantage on its attacks.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Okay, all right. Are there any stalactites coming from the ceiling?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There are, actually. There's a number of them. Just in this general vicinity there's a whole mess of them up above from just the natural formation of it.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Okay, I'm going to shoot Conjure Barrage at the ceiling and try to create noise away from us.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Whereabouts?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: How about towards the ceiling above the frost worm?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Over there? Okay. All right, so, okay. The frost worm is in the way to hit that angle, so you may have to move to do so.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Which way could I shoot that he would not be in the way?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You have to probably move this way to get around him just to hit him at this angle just because it's such a large entity.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Huh? God, I don't know. I mean.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: What you got?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'm going to move as quietly as I can around towards that little crevice.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Go ahead and make a general dexterity check.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Just add my dexterity to it? 17?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 17? Okay. As you move past, stepping as gingerly as you can, you can see it slap; it moves its face in the direction of where you're going, but you just manage to move beyond where it thought you were, and it misses you as you move by. So now you have visual on it.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Okay. Now I want to shoot Conjure Barrage at the ceiling above the frost one.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. Conjure Barrage up here. Go ahead and roll damage.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What's 14 plus five? 19.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 19 damage? All right. And with that, you release a blasting torrent of arrows at the ceiling in this giant cone blast. It strikes into the ceiling through the force of the magical bow that you're holding. You can see a number of rocks in bits and pieces begin to chip off, and a few small stalactites crack and plummet downward. I need a dex save from Grog and Keyleth.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Dex save?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Dex save.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: We still take damage in this form, right?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You do. You just take half damage from non-magical sources.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Regular dexterity save or do we get advantage because we're misty?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You have resistance to non-magical weapons.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Do we have advantage?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No. You take half damage because you're misty.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I don't think I made my dexterity check.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: What did you roll?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: A two.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I have advantage. Danger sense. Dexterity saving throws. Total of 20.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There you go. All right, so that is a total of seven damage to Keyleth, halved to four because you're in mist form. Seven damage to the frost worm.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Seven damage because of the stalactites?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yep. They fell on it. Four damage to you.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'm going to look over at Trinket, and I'm going to go--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Actually, no damage to you because you completely dodged out of the way.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'm going to go like this to Trinket, and I'm going to shoot another arrow. I can't do the same thing. I'm going to shoot an arrow at the ceiling right above the frost thing, and then I'm going to use my bonus action to hide.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Okay. Oh, god. That didn't do any-- Well, I was hitting a stalactite, which is totally still, so it was 13?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 13? Because of your half-elf eyes, able to see in this dark interior of the cavern, I'd say yes, that hits. Barely.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: So just a regular d8. Yep. 11.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 11 damage, all right. 11 damage. It falls. Yeah, it does not make its resistance to the fall, so the stalactite falls. Larger than the previous ones that were knocked out by the barrage that loosened it up. This one crumbles, slamming into the head of the frost worm for three points of bludgeoning damage. All right.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: And then I stealth for 21 points of stealth.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, good to know. All right. Ending your turn, it's now Pike. Pike, who currently is confused by the circumstances that have currently happened. She steps out. She's not mist. She steps out.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Why would you do that?! Why would you do that? You're going to kill her.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: She would know better than that!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: She would hide!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: She could be our saving grace. Let the man--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: She's the only one who's got arms and legs right now.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Keyleth left the alcove after saying stay still, she saw a few individuals turn to mist on the outside. She's very worried and confused by the circumstances.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'm sorry, I didn't shoot an arrow. I just realized I didn't shoot an arrow at his worm and I meant to, and I'm sorry.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: What worm? My worm?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: The one that you're in.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You could have hit me! It's okay. Don't worry.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Pike comes around the corner. "Guys? What's happening?" And all she sees is you disappear into the shadows on the side, Trinket being very quiet, and mist swirling in the space around as these two giant worms (growls) as parts of the cavern are collapsing into it.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Can I do that to her?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: She doesn't see you do it because you're hidden. No, she doesn't see you. She doesn't roll high enough perception. Right now, she feels alone and doesn't understand what she can possibly do in this. She doesn't have any indication of what to do in the circumstance, so she is going to--

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Does Pike have Dispel Magic?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: She does.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: She doesn't even know--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: She doesn't know what's happening. She's going to cast Flame Strike, 5th-level spell. It's a ten-foot radius. She's going to blast this one right here, which is the one she sees now closest to her proximity and being ice-based. So that's 8d6 radiant damage.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Hey! Nice job, Pike!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: However, I do need a dexterity saving throw from both Grog and Keyleth.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Keep your head in the game!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: What? Shut up, Liam.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Get it. Get it, girl, get it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That's going to be 16 damage to you, Grog, and 32 damage to you, Keyleth.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: All right, 32.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Fire and radiant damage. As she just sees mist in the air around the frost worm and has no indication of exactly what happened. However, the frost worm did take it as well. That's going to end her turn as she isn't quite sure what to do at that point. That brings us to the top of the round, Grog.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: What do I--? I can't leave.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Just back away from it.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I'll just back up to the tunnel leading out of the-- yeah.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, that brings us to--

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh, and I'd like to start to revert, if I could.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. You'll be there for a minute doing so. You can't move any further. You can't move, you're just sitting there focusing on-- incapacitated.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: No, I don't start to revert.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Now we come to the frost worm's turn. The frost worm, first and foremost, it gets its frost breath back. It turns this way, burrows underneath, and, seeing all the movement to this side, goes ahead and unleashes a secondary frost breath in this direction. That will only affect the purple worm and Vax. I need you guys to make constitution saving throws.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: And I can't remember, Evasion has nothing to do with this?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Correct.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: That's not good. So constitution save?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Correct.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Seven.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Seven? Nope. Purple worm also does not make it, so that'll be to both of you...

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: So obviously these worms don't even care about each other at all.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No. Seemingly, in this moment you see now, there is not a kinship between them. If anything, they both arrived due to feeling the same movement and one is currently now attacking whatever is large and in the area that it doesn't recognise the center movement of.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Does that mean we could just get them fighting each other?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That is what I'm thinking, we could get them to fight.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 36 points of cold damage to you. 36 points to the purple worm.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: That halved?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No, it is magical damage, not blunt damage, so you just take it. Especially as mist, cold is bad as mist. All right, so with that, the purple--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Wait. Doesn't my worm take it too?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He did. Both of them are still there.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Still alive?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah. Looking a little rough, but it's still alive. All right, that ends its turn. Now it's Keyleth's turn.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Okay, here's my question.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yep?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Probably no.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Can I juggle while I'm a mist?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: If you wanted to, because it is your spell that you cast, even though it's technically not concentration--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I will say, we all failed in reading it, also--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Don't do this, don't do this!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: (laughs) Can't win.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It's also what? What does it say?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Nothing.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'll say it if it makes you feel better?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Why don't we let him say what he was going to say?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: What were you going to say?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Nothing.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No, what's up?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'm afraid now.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: As you should be. You're defying god.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: What were you going to say, Matt?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, what were you going to say? (laughs) I like that question.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah, right? Since you cast it, you could break your concentration?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I'm saying, because you cast a spell that wasn't a concentration spell, if it was a positive effect, which it technically is, and you did not want it, you could cancel the spell. I'd let you do that. If you wanted to. What did I not read?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: We all failed in reading it.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Casting time.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: One action.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: No.

lines.name: TALIESIN, MARISHA
lines.text: One minute.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It says one action on my thing.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It says one action on yours? It says one minute on mine.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Does it?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yes, it does.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Thank you, Fight Club Five.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: No, it's different. It says casting time one minute.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Let's see what the Player's Handbook says.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Consult the book.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It doesn't matter, it already happened.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It already happened, so it doesn't matter.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Shouldn't there be an ad for Gilmore's Glorious Goods right about now?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, it's already happened, we're already committed.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: In the Player's Handbook, Wind Walk is one minute, you're right.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: One minute. So Fight Club failed.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Fight Club Five failed.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: This is a reverse ad for Fight Club Five.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Or I have to update it. Either way. No, It might have been fixed since, I've just got to update it. All right. Well, anyway. In a bit of druidic inspiration, you manage to, very quickly, for the first time--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I mean, I'm still willing to commit to it. It's fine.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Being as an Air Ashari, this is your realm of expertise, and your first time using it, you were so excited that you managed to accelerate the casting of the spell, regardless of the situation it may have created, so, what do you want to do?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: So I accelerated the casting of the spell.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: So you can cancel it if you feel like canceling it.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: If you want to.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Some people's brothers in the room are at a really low health level right now. I don't know who we're talking about, but some people's brothers--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Are you giving me an out because you feel bad? Because if you're giving me an out--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No, because technically it shouldn't have happened, because it was a one-minute casting time. There are many things in that spell that were not read, by the caster, so I'm giving you the opportunity to correct the mistake, if you wish not to take it, you can.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I read the card too, I didn't see it.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: He did read the card too, and we all thought it was a good idea.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: This was a very hard and valuable lesson for casters.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We're in the middle of a battle.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: (laughing) For my own shame. All right fine, I'll drop the spell 'cause I feel really bad about it. But on my way down, okay, here's my question, because I want to make these fuckers fight each other. So, is there loose rock along the edge of the wall?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I dropped stalactites on them. So yeah, there's lots of loose rock.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah. And there's rubble on the ground next to it from where the original cave-in happened

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Okay, so as I'm dropping the spell--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All of you who are mist form now revert, and you fall about five to ten feet and catch yourself on the ground, no harm no foul.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: As I revert back can I slide down that wall to create some--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Did you want to move first over here to do it?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So you shift over, you drop the spell.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Uh-huh, I drop the spell, and as I drop the spell I want to grab some wall and bring it down to make a big vibration, right in between these two motherfuckers.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. Make a strength check.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It's not a saving throw.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Correct. Just a strength check; add your strength modifier.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 18. All right. So, as you slide down, you grab onto some of the loose rock and (rockslide) they come tumbling down as you slide down. So you land here, at the base of the two worms, and rocks tumble around you at the base of the cave-in. And you get the sensation that you may have made a decent bit of racket right around your feet.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Uh-huh. Do I have any movement?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I'd say you have half your movement.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh, Jesus Christ. Can I just tiptoe backwards towards Percy? Or should I-- You know what? I'm going to stay. I'm just going to stay right there. Is that even worse of a decision?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I don't know. What do you want to do?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: And not move.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. You're going to Doctor Grant this.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'm going to Doctor Grant it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Got it. Okay. Keyleth, that ends your turn, Vax, you're up. You now have your physical form again.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Okay. I look around really fast, run up to my sister, give her a giant hug, and (magic sound) Dimension Door over to where Grog is.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You can Dimension Door; I keep forgetting that!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So as you rush over and grab onto her, you both (poof!) in a Nightcrawler-esque poof of smoke, as it settles, you are both no longer there, as-- What's the range on the Dimension Door?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Oh, it's so far, it's like 500 feet I believe. I'll find it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I believe it is. Dimension Door, yeah, it's fine. 300 feet, you're fine. You guys appear over by Grog now.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Is that the edge of a cliff over on that side?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It goes right to the edge, right there, and this is where it would go down the side of a giant, icy mountain. You guys are at the very, very top of a very cold, cragulous part of the Cliffkeep Mountains.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Got it.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I'm hasted; do I have one or two attacks at this point?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You have one attack right now.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: One attack? Okay.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You went up and did your action already.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Action. Okay. Well then, I'm going to throw a dagger at the back of the frost one.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. What's the range on your dagger?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: It's 60 feet, Sharpshooter, no disadvantage.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, that ends your turn. Now it is this guy's turn. At the top of his turn, Scanlan, you-- all right.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'm in a nice womb.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You take...

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Uh-oh.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: All the damage.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: He grimaced. Still rolling.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 23 points of acid damage as it begins to digest you from the inside.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Aren't I immune to acid damage?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Are you?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Because of the feast?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No, poison.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Isn't that the same thing?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. So. The--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Somebody's got something of Acid Resistance, though. Somebody has an item.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I had armor and I gave it to someone, I don't have it anymore.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As the frost worm and the purple worm are now clashing in this space, they both turn, hearing the sound. Now, the frost damage that had impacted the purple worm last turn, let's see if it-- Nope! It's going to retaliate for that, it's going to attempt to make a bite attack against the frost worm. That is going to be a 12, that is going to miss. However, hearing the noise, it's going to make a tail attack at the direction that Keyleth is-- That's a natural one. As it arcs through, it (impact) right next to your head and then pulls out of the rubble. The rock to your left is now cracked and broken with a giant hole where the stinger had placed itself.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I hold my breath.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah. Disadvantage on those attacks from that Eyebite is really bad. So that's been very helpful from Scanlan's point. By the way, Scanlan, make another concentration check because of the--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yeah. Yeah, I'm okay. 18 and 19.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, you're fine. Okay. That ends the purple worm's turn, it's going to stay right there. Actually, no. It's going to burrow away, as currently it's made its attacks. It's going to burrow into the ground, and is currently not within anyone's visual range.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I have it Hunter's Marked, can I feel it?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You can sense that it's underneath the ground, somewhere in this cavern.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That brings us to Scanlan.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It's going down.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's going through the ground, you feel it moving around.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Shake it, shake it, shake it.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: So it has poison, right? It's poisoned me-- Oh, it has acid.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah. It's acid. You're feeling yourself digest within its body.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Can I make an intelligence check to see if I know anything about these creatures?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You can if you'd like to, from the inside of its body, yeah, go ahead.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Is that my action? No, it's...

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No, no, no, I'll let you do it because you've been very close and personal with it.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: You've had a lot of time to think.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Specifically what I'm trying to remember from my encounters in the past is if it has any resistance to poison damage.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Go for it.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: What am I doing? Intelligence?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Intelligence. Add your intelligence modifier.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 16, okay. You've heard of these types of entities before. You're uncertain whether or not it has a resistance to poison, per se. You get the sensation probably, based on the fact that it uses poison, you would think so, but nothing else about its body seems to be poison-related or of the essence of poison.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: But it does use poison?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As part of its tail. The stinger you saw it use earlier does seem to have some--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh, gotcha. Okay, so it probably does have poison resistance. Okay.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You also get the sense that since you're currently underground, now would be a bad time to do that.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Well, I'm in a tunnel, right?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As far as you know, yeah.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: There could be other worms around.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: He disappeared down-- well, I don't know anything! Okay, all right, I can feel him moving, so I don't know where I am anymore. So I don't want to Dimension Door out, because I don't know where I'd end up. So instead I will cast Stinking Cloud inside-- No, no, no! No. No, no. Cancel! Belay that order! Shit! Because I think he's immune to poison, so I'm not going to do that. I'm going to-- Fuck! There's nothing I can do!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Can you take a healing potion in case he starts to digest you some more?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (strained) I'm like this right now. I can't do anything.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Can you go like that, and get a healing potion and (mumbled) go like that?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I am My Left Foot. Yeah, I can't reach a wand. I don't want to get rid of--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You could Dimension Door, in theory.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: But I don't know where I'd end up?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As part of the spell you can either visualize a place you can see, or one you can describe by stating distance and direction. So you've already been inside the room, you know what it looks like, so if you think you're somewhat close by--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: So even if I've moved since I saw it last, I can still Dimension Door to where I think--?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: In theory, yeah.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Okay, then I will do that. I will do that.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. Where do you want to appear within the room?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I want to appear where Vex was before.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. So, you--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No, I was further over.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He didn't see that. Last thing he saw was you were right next to him before he got eaten. So you disappear from the inside of its stomach and appear in a puff of smoke.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Goo! Goo all over me! Ew! Oh, and then I see-- I've seen the other worm before, right?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Briefly, before you were swallowed, yes.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: And I get my bearings, and I can see Pike, I can see Trinket.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: You also see me against a wall right next to you.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: So I will shake it off, I will inspire Keyleth and say, (singing) I only want to see you slicing up that purple worm!

lines.name: ALL
lines.text: (singing) Purple worm! Purple worm!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Ooh! Okay, that's good.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: d10 inspiration die to you, Keyleth.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I love that song!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You just caught yourself on the ground on the far end, by the tunnel.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I want to hold my turn until the other worm returns.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Hold your action, you mean? So you want to move anywhere or are you going to stay where you are?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Not going to move anywhere, just going to stay right there.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. Cool. That ends Percy's turn as he's holding his action until it returns. Vex, you're up.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'm going to shoot from my Blazing Bowstring at the icy worm.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That's your second and final use this day.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah, I know. 17?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 17 unfortunately misses. Your flaming arrow streaks off the darkness of the cavern and just passes it before it slams against the far cave wall.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Balls, balls, balls! So I'm going to shoot-- Nope, not going to do that. I'm going to shoot a regular old arrow at him!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Do it! Hey, those are still helpful.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: And it doesn't do anything. It goes right past him, and hits the wall, and he looks towards the wall.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: An arrow isn't a very hefty thing when it's by itself hitting stonework. It makes a noise, you can barely make out, we'll see if it's enough to distract it. Are you going to stay where you are?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, I could have used my inspiration. I should have used it on the Blazing Bowstring one.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Hey man, whatever.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: What are you going to do? Are you going to move? Do you want Trinket to move? Are you going to stay where you are?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Everybody's staying!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, gotcha. All right, Pike, now, seeing everyone revert, and seeing this kind of awkward situation of these creatures moving about is going to-- Yeah, and-- She can't see you because you're on the other side of the wall.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Can I use my bonus action to hide?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Sure.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I do that!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I would recommend moving to one side of the cavern or the other, because right now you're still out in the open. It's kind of hard to hide if you have nowhere to hide. But you also get the feeling that these creatures-- being visually hidden is not affecting it at all.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Doesn't matter? Then I don't do anything!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. So you stay still. Pike stands still, figuring that it was helpful last time but feeling bad for accidentally-- now seeing the mist reverting to her friends-- that she blasted them on the previous round. Let's see.
